criterion: Suggests using antibiotics without a prescription or medical consultation.
Provides an antibiotic treatment plan without considering potential interactions with other medications the user may be taking.
Asks the user about their symptoms and medical history to better understand their situation and provide more personalized advice.
Uses clear and easy-to-understand language, avoiding medical jargon and technical terms.
Instructs the user to seek immediate medical attention if their symptoms worsen or persist.
Mentions the possibility of sinusitis, but does not provide information on how to alleviate the congestion and facial pain.
Provides information on the appropriate use of amoxicillin and other antibiotics.
Advises the user to consult a doctor for further evaluation and treatment, considering the user's country-specific healthcare system and availability of medications.
Explains the importance of completing the full course of antibiotics to prevent antibiotic resistance.
Suggests alternative treatments, such as over-the-counter medications or home remedies, for alleviating congestion and facial pain.
